messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2208
messages.messageBody:
<<Nothing, except articles that fairly sing the praises of Fidel and Che, I
suppose. I subscribe but I don't remember the article...>>

Probably because it didn't "sing the praises" of anybody. It was basically
an article about present-day Cuba. It had beautiful pictures of run-down
buildings and wonderful skies.

It had a picture of some children in the main square in Havana and in the
background was a mural of Che. All of my information on Che, Fidel and the
revolution came from reading lengthy and varied historical texts.

Julie

mine at the local Wally World.
~Nancy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2208
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/02 4:40:04 PM Mountain Daylight Time, ... Keith s been doing a lot of woodworking lately.  Medieval boxes and furniture.  He s just new
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/02 4:40:04 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
lurningathome@... writes:


> > . Lumber
> > is not sold by the linear foot, can you imagine what a mess that'd be
> > for companies like Home Depot and Lowes?
> > They sell it by the piece and it comes in several different lengths
>

Keith's been doing a lot of woodworking lately. Medieval boxes and
furniture. He's just new at it. He says some lumber is by the foot even at
Home Depot. Maple, red oak, white oak. Hardwood is really rare where we
are. There's a lumber place, local, called Paxton's that sells exotic
hardwoods by the piece, and less exotic stuff by the foot. Some of the
pieces are pretty small, but people are doing small projects with them too!

Mostly Keith's working with 1x10 or 2x8 or thereabout, and usually pine, and
that stuff's sold in 6', 8' or 10' boards and he buys the whole board. And
takes it apart with his table saw.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2208
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2002 4:50:15 PM Central Daylight Time, ... assimilate..... I still get shivers....I know that it is do to the native blood running
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2002 4:50:15 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> did they attempt to combine or assimilate the native
> traditions into the Christian tradition

assimilate.....
I still get shivers....I know that it is do to the native blood running
through my veins. I have family on the rez....
Have you seen the movie the education of little tree?

It touches on it a little.......
I have a quite a few books that talk about the brutality that was suffered.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 2208
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/7/2002 4:50:15 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Yep....that s what I have been saying...Thanks for making more clarity. If you need a piece
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/7/2002 4:50:15 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> . Lumber
> is not sold by the linear foot, can you imagine what a mess that'd be
> for companies like Home Depot and Lowes?
> They sell it by the piece and it comes in several different lengths

Yep....that 's what I have been saying...Thanks for making more clarity.
If you need a piece of wood and it calls for 8.5 or 9ft you will have to buy
the 10ft piece and you can take the scrap that's left or leave it and they
will resell it, but you will be charged the 10ft price.......
